Apologies if this has been raised/discussed elsewhere. Done a few searches and
seen threads which imply that this may be supported, but in my SVN checkout of
Batik trunk I can only see getURL.

Tried a simple SVG with the latest Adobe viewer and postURL seems to work with
that, so I think it may now be a supported part of the standard.

May take a look at what's involved in adding it into Rhino myself, will update
this RFE if I do.
creator: robw@ascert.com
cam@apache.org
text:
Hi Rob.

(In reply to comment #0)
> Apologies if this has been raised/discussed elsewhere. Done a few searches and
> seen threads which imply that this may be supported, but in my SVN checkout of
> Batik trunk I can only see getURL.

It is in there.  See org.apache.batik.bridge.ScriptingEnvironment.Window.postURL.

> Tried a simple SVG with the latest Adobe viewer and postURL seems to work with
> that, so I think it may now be a supported part of the standard.

Well I wouldn't rely on ASV to help you determine what is defined as part of the
spec. :)

postURL actually isn't specified by SVG 1.1.  It's more of a de facto standard.

creator: robw@ascert.com
text:
Wow!!!

Thanks for rapid response

I was just looking at that area myself - I'm wondering if it's the javascript
binding that's missing, as I get "missing function" errors when I try and use it.

Looking at WindowWrapper, I noticed the following:

    public WindowWrapper(Context context) {
        super(context);
        String[] names = { "setInterval", "setTimeout", "clearInterval",
                           "clearTimeout", "parseXML", "getURL", "alert",
                           "confirm", "prompt" };


Maybe postURL just needs to be included to that list?

-- Rob

creator: cam@apache.org
text:
Yes, you're right.  With a small fix in the WindowWrapper.postURL function, it
seems to work fine.  Fix is in SVN.  Thanks for pointing this out.
